result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:41 PM.
Defendant Timothy C Rutledge not in court.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Timothy C Rutledge.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Caffee has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and has not had contact with the Defendant.
State requests bench warrant as the Defendant was present when this hearing was scheduled.
Warrant ordered.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

9:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Rutledge appeared by video.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Timothy C Rutledge. Attorney Caffee requests a preliminary hearing. 

Defendant was given a cash bond on 05/11/22 and was ordered to pay $5,000 cash bond and return signed bond by 05/20/22. Defendant has not done either to date. State requests a warrant. 
Court orders a warrant due to non payment of cash bond. Defendant will need to appear in person at next hearing unless cash is posted.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:41 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy C Rutledge in court.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Timothy C Rutledge.
Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 11:29 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person
Defendant Timothy C Rutledge appeared via video (from California). Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Timothy C Rutledge.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
State requests $25,000 Cash Bond (No ties to EC, mandatory prison time, active OWI/supervision). Court orders $5,000 Cash bond to be posted by 12:00 PM on 5/20/22.
Bond will be mailed to the Defendant to sign and return to the Clerk of Courts. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/25/22 at 3:30 PM.
RTN: 6/22/22 at 9:30 AM.
Letter to defendant with cash bond ordered in court 05/11/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 05/20/2022.

Conditions:
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
